Your Guide to York's biggest sports clubs

An insight into eight of the biggest clubs on campus, with predictions for their forthcoming BUCS campaigns and the all-important trial times for first years. (Thumbnail credit York's Lacrosse club are tipped for a successful 2009-2010)

York remain unbeatable as Leeds are swept aside in pre-BUCS friendly match

York's rugby firsts have still yet to suffer defeat in 2009 after this comprehensive victory over Leeds University on Sunday. (Thumbnail credit Mike Callis collects a line-out against Leeds on Sunday)

York Sport President

And so, another year of sport at York is looming. The second year of York Sport's existence looks like it should be as compelling as its first. With the clubs showing a much more united front, playing in their matching black and gold strips, it will hopefully be a year of York clubs supporting each other as well as themselves. (Thumbnail credit Emily Scoot, York Sport President)

Introducing the newcomers to the York Sport line-up this year

<strong>Clay pigeon shooting, rounders and trix</strong> (Thumbnail credit Clay Pigeon Club logo)

And now for something different...

Sports Editor Adam Shergold offers the lowdown on the remaining roster of York's sports clubs, from the orthodox to the plain odd. (Thumbnail credit The York Hornets Cheerleading Squad)

Season Preview - Futsal

With play-offs for the FA National League looming, the Futsal Club are hoping to match the very best teams in the country in another year of success (Thumbnail credit Photograph: Shaun Morton)

Encouraging signs for men's football, but it's just a run-out

The 3-3 result in Saturday's UYAFC trial match meant positives on both sides as their respective BUCS campaigns loom (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

New society aims to tackle dissent in college football

Referee Society, new to campus, are aiming to address the perennial problem of college football matches being played without officials

York open NEMLA campaign with resounding win

The men's lacrosse team beat Heaton Mersey in fine style on Saturday afternoon in the perfect start to their season (Thumbnail credit Photograph: George Lowther)

Season Preview - Women's Football

After retaining the majority of last season's squad, the women's football team are gunning for silverware this season (Thumbnail credit Photograph by George Lowther)

Season Preview - Men's Football

Following post-season advances on and off the field, the University Football Club are limbering up for the 2009-2010 season (Thumbnail credit Photograph: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Season Preview - Women's Hockey

The women's firsts are hoping to shrug off last season's disappointments and return to BUCS League 2B at the earliest opportunity (Thumbnail credit Photograph: George Lowther)

York City battle from behind to down Harriers

Goals from in-form strike duo Richard Brodie and Michael Gash delivered another victory for the Minstermen on Saturday

Season Preview - Men's Hockey

With a largely unchanged side, the men's firsts are hoping to improve on last season's disappointments and challenge for promotion in BUCS League 2B (Thumbnail credit Photograph: Sam Newsome)

York City preserve unbeaten record at the death

Michael Gash's dramatic late header earned the Minstermen a point at home to Cambridge United on Tuesday evening

Season Preview - Men's Lacrosse

Having acquired the services of an experienced American coach, the men's lacrosse team are hoping to improve on last season's mid-table finish (Thumbnail credit Photograph: George Lowther)

York City stretch unbeaten run to five

A 2-0 victory over Crawley Town and a battling goalless draw at Barrow have elevated the Minstermen to eighth position in Blue Square Premier

York City hit their stride with win double

Back-to-back league victories against Gateshead and Histon have left Minstermen supporters dreaming of a return to the Football League

Inconsistencies continue to plague York City

An eventful week for the Minstermen, which yielded a win and a defeat, ended with a 1-1 draw with Hayes and Yeading United on Saturday

Disappointing start for York City

One point gained from a possible six in Blue Square Premier has suggested that York City's summer signings might not be enough to challenge for honours

The College Cup Final

Watch the entire college cup final, filmed by YSTV and commentary by Nouse. (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

The Nouse Sports Awards 2009

As York's most successful year of sport draws to a close, Nouse salutes those individuals and teams who have excelled for the White Rose. (Thumbnail credit Mike Callis during York's 31-8 Roses victory)

Alcuin too strong for Vanbrugh in memorable College Cup final

Alcuin claimed the College Cup on Monday evening, beating Vanbrugh 3-1 in an end-to-end final. (Thumbnail credit Photos: George Lowther)

Scott undaunted by York Sport challenge

Sports Editor Adam Shergold finds the incoming York Sport President in a confident mood as she prepares to take the reins from Alex Lacy next week

The College Cup: Tournament Review

Turmoil in Iran, the economy in the doldrums, the retirement of Tugay: in many ways this term has been a torrid interlude in the usually blissful reverie that is life in the 21st Century. But, as the tempestuous waves of world events crash all around us, the College Cup has kept everyone entertained. (Thumbnail credit Cup magic)

The Mixer

Tucking into our chicken, erm, 'supreme', having blagged our way, Gordon Brown-like, onto the top table, TM takes in the surroundings of the York Sport Dinner.

Rowers miss out at prestigious Henley Regatta

York's senior men's squad narrowly missed out on qualifying for the finals of Henley Royal Regatta last Friday, a feat only achieved three times in the history of the university. (Thumbnail credit Photograph: The four at Doncaster recently. By Irene Sieberger )

College Cup final date decided

The College Cup final between Alcuin and Vanbrugh will take place on Monday Week 10 at 6.00pm on the JLD astroturf. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

Alex Lacy's Final Word

Alex Lacy, outgoing York Sport President, reflects on his year in office (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

The College Cup Final Preview Show

Looking forward to the final of the college cup? Nouse and YSTV have a preview show, with interviews, highlights of the semis and a team of panellists discussing the pending match.
